items.longDescription:
The design is chosen from the scene at the beginning of the "The Scarlet School Trip" episode, which depicts a school trip to Kyoto from Teitan High School where Shinichi and Ran attended. The design shows the bittersweet scene of the moment Sonoko takes a two-shot of them, while she worries about the future of Shinichi and Ran's relationship.

Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed)

After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes and art, are available only at UNIQLO.

©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan

items.longDescription:
UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat

“UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

Fujiko・F・Fujio 90th Anniversary

Fujiko・F・Fujio created many masterpieces including "DORAEMON". This time, UT has designed graphic T-shirts featuring famous characters and scenes from his many works. This is a commemorative collection featuring special art for the 90th anniversary and art from his original works.

Fujiko・F・Fujio
Birth name, Hiroshi Fujimoto. Born on December 1st, 1933, in Takaoka-city of Toyama Prefecture, Fujimoto made his professional debut as a manga artist in 1951. Having moved to Tokyo with his friend, Motoo Abiko, in 1954, they formally started writing under the joint pen name "Fujiko Fujio". After the dissolution of their partnership in 1987, Fujimoto continued writing under the "Fujiko・F・Fujio" pseudonym, and built a new era of manga aimed at children. DORAEMON, his most renowned manga series, has been translated into 17 languages and appears in 20 different countries/regions, as it continues to be read by children all around the world.

©Fujiko-Pro

METAL GEAR Archive

Experience the thrill of tactical espionage action missions, sneaking into hostile environments without being detected by the enemy. This innovative game series was born from the idea of avoiding combat and infiltrating enemy territory undetected, a complete reversal of common action gameplay resulting in the creation of a brand-new game genre: stealth action. T-shirt of the series celebrating the series celebrated its 35th anniversary in 2022.

©Konami Digital Entertainment

items.longDescription:
Curated by Tate Gallery

UNIQLO is Made for All. Tate’s Art is for All. Tate and UNIQLO have been in partnership since 2016, championing a shared belief that Art and Play are for everyone. For this UT collection, we have chosen artworks from Tate collection artists that reflect the spirit of Play.

Bob and Roberta Smith
Bob and Roberta Smith is a British artist, writer, musician, and advocate. He is best known for his playful and brightly coloured ‘slogan art’, a mix of sign writing, activism, and discarded materials. His work highlights the importance of creativity in politics and education. Smith says he sees ‘art as an important element in democratic life.’

items.longDescription:
Hokusai Remixed

Ukiyo-e prints were produced through a three-step process: the artist draws the image, a craftsman carves the woodblocks, and a printer applies pigments to the woodblocks and prints them on Japanese paper. As a result, many ukiyo-e works share the same motif but vary in textures and colors. This collection is made by reconstructing many of Katsushika Hokusai's Ukiyo-e works produced in this way.

Fujiko・F・Fujio 90th Anniversary

Fujiko・F・Fujio created many masterpieces including "DORAEMON". This time, UT has designed graphic T-shirts featuring famous characters and scenes from his many works. This is a commemorative collection featuring special art for the 90th anniversary and art from his original works.

Fujiko・F・Fujio
Birth name, Hiroshi Fujimoto. Born on December 1st, 1933, in Takaoka-city of Toyama Prefecture, Fujimoto made his professional debut as a manga artist in 1951. Having moved to Tokyo with his friend, Motoo Abiko, in 1954, they formally started writing under the joint pen name "Fujiko Fujio". After the dissolution of their partnership in 1987, Fujimoto continued writing under the "Fujiko・F・Fujio" pseudonym, and built a new era of manga aimed at children. DORAEMON, his most renowned manga series, has been translated into 17 languages and appears in 20 different countries/regions, as it continues to be read by children all around the world.

©Fujiko-Pro

Conan Edogawa and Kid the Phantom Thief are rivals but sometimes help each other. These two key characters of the Detective Conan series are featured on this UT, which was designed by Gosho Aoyama, the author of the original manga.

Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed)

After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes and art, are available only at UNIQLO.

©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan

items.longDescription:
UNIQLO and Marimekko are pleased to announce the new limited-edition collection just in time for a joyful summer sun. The new collection offers a wide array of breezy, comfortable dress, cut and sewn and skirt made in cotton and linen, along with hats, shoes, and bags for easy coordination. This collection features Marimekko’s world-renowned prints: Melooni (melon), Ruukku (pot) by Maija Isola, Lirinä (sound of gurgling water), Asema (station) by Pentti Rinta, along with Demeter by Katsuji Wakisaka and Galleria (gallery) by Vuokko Eskolin-Nurmesniemi. These vibrant and colorful patterns, full of the feeling of summer fun, are available for women, kids, and babies.

- 100% cotton.
- Sleeveless, V-neck design.
- Voluminous A-line silhouette.
- With convenient pockets.
*Please note that pattern placement may differ from the photo. Your understanding is appreciated.
